positive_examples: This is an example of semantic boundary.
The semantic boundary demonstrated clear characteristics.
We observed semantic boundary in this context.
A typical case of semantic boundary would involve these features.
The concept of semantic boundary applies here.
The limits that define the meaning and scope of a concept in relation to other concepts in a semantic space.
negative_examples: This is an example of decision boundary, not semantic boundary.
This represents concept boundary in general.
The document was filed in the cabinet.
She walked to the store to buy groceries.
training_hints.disambiguation: Not to be confused with: DecisionBoundary, or other types of ConceptBoundary

definition: A conceptual threshold separating distinct meanings or interpretations.
